meanings.definition: A platform enclosed by a wall or balustrade on the outside of a building, with access from an upper-floor window or door.
meanings.sent1: From the balcony, you can see the whole street below.
meanings.sent2: She stood on the balcony, enjoying the view of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to nap on the balcony, pretending to be the king of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The balcony is like a private stage overlooking the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The balcony, with its iron railing, felt like a safe haven above the chaos of the city.

meanings.definition: A projecting gallery in a theater.
meanings.sent1: The actors entered the scene from the balcony above.
meanings.sent2: The audience cheered as the singer performed on the balcony.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the balcony seemed to have a life of its own, whispering secrets to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The balcony in the theater was a magical spot where dreams came to life.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight shone on the balcony, creating a dramatic effect on the stage.
